default_permission.description:
No features are enabled by default, as we believe
the clipboard can be inherently dangerous and it is 
application specific if read and/or write access is needed.

Clipboard interaction needs to be explicitly enabled.

allow-clear.description: Enables the clear command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-image.description: Enables the read_image command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-text.description: Enables the read_text command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-write-text.description: Denies the write_text command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:
Default core plugins set which includes:
- 'core:path:default'
- 'core:event:default'
- 'core:window:default'
- 'core:webview:default'
- 'core:app:default'
- 'core:image:default'
- 'core:resources:default'
- 'core:menu:default'
- 'core:tray:default'

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures the types of dialogs
available from the dialog plugin.

#### Granted Permissions

All dialog types are enabled.

allow-ask.description: Enables the ask command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-confirm.description: Enables the confirm command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-message.description: Enables the message command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-open.description: Enables the open command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-save.description: Enables the save command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-ask.description: Denies the ask command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-confirm.description: Denies the confirm command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-message.description: Denies the message command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-open.description: Denies the open command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-save.description: Denies the save command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:
This set of permissions describes the what kind of
file system access the `fs` plugin has enabled or denied by default.

#### Granted Permissions

This default permission set enables read access to the
application specific directories (AppConfig, AppData, AppLocalData, AppCache,
AppLog) and all files and sub directories created in it.
The location of these directories depends on the operating system,
where the application is run.

In general these directories need to be manually created
by the application at runtime, before accessing files or folders
in it is possible.

Therefore, it is also allowed to create all of these folders via
the `mkdir` command.

#### Denied Permissions

This default permission set prevents access to critical components
of the Tauri application by default.
On Windows the webview data folder access is denied.

#### Included permissions within this default permission set:

allow-copy-file.description: Enables the copy_file command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-create.description: Enables the create command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-exists.description: Enables the exists command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-fstat.description: Enables the fstat command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-ftruncate.description: Enables the ftruncate command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-lstat.description: Enables the lstat command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-mkdir.description: Enables the mkdir command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-open.description: Enables the open command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read.description: Enables the read command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-dir.description: Enables the read_dir command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-file.description: Enables the read_file command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-text-file.description: Enables the read_text_file command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-text-file-lines.description: Enables the read_text_file_lines command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-read-text-file-lines-next.description: Enables the read_text_file_lines_next command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-remove.description: Enables the remove command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-rename.description: Enables the rename command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-seek.description: Enables the seek command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-size.description: Enables the size command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-stat.description: Enables the stat command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-truncate.description: Enables the truncate command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-unwatch.description: Enables the unwatch command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-watch.description: Enables the watch command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-write.description: Enables the write command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-write-file.description: Enables the write_file command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-write-text-file.description: Enables the write_text_file command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-webview-data-linux.description:
This denies read access to the
`$APPLOCALDATA` folder on linux as the webview data and configuration values are stored here.
Allowing access can lead to sensitive information disclosure and should be well considered.

deny-webview-data-windows.description:
This denies read access to the
`$APPLOCALDATA/EBWebView` folder on windows as the webview data and configuration values are stored here.
Allowing access can lead to sensitive information disclosure and should be well considered.

deny-write.description: Denies the write command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-write-file.description: Denies the write_file command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-write-text-file.description: Denies the write_text_file command without any pre-configured scope.

read-all.description: This enables all read related commands without any pre-configured accessible paths.

read-app-specific-dirs-recursive.description:
This permission allows recursive read functionality on the application
specific base directories.

read-dirs.description: This enables directory read and file metadata related commands without any pre-configured accessible paths.

read-files.description: This enables file read related commands without any pre-configured accessible paths.

read-meta.description: This enables all index or metadata related commands without any pre-configured accessible paths.

scope.description: An empty permission you can use to modify the global scope.

scope-app.description: This scope permits access to all files and list content of top level directories in the application folders.

scope-app-index.description: This scope permits to list all files and folders in the application directories.

scope-app-recursive.description: This scope permits recursive access to the complete application folders, including sub directories and files.

deny-default.description: This denies access to dangerous Tauri relevant files and folders by default.

anyOf.description:
A path that can be accessed by the webview when using the fs APIs. FS scope path pattern.

The pattern can start with a variable that resolves to a system base directory. The variables are: `$AUDIO`, `$CACHE`, `$CONFIG`, `$DATA`, `$LOCALDATA`, `$DESKTOP`, `$DOCUMENT`, `$DOWNLOAD`, `$EXE`, `$FONT`, `$HOME`, `$PICTURE`, `$PUBLIC`, `$RUNTIME`, `$TEMPLATE`, `$VIDEO`, `$RESOURCE`, `$APP`, `$LOG`, `$TEMP`, `$APPCONFIG`, `$APPDATA`, `$APPLOCALDATA`, `$APPCACHE`, `$APPLOG`.

path.description:
A path that can be accessed by the webview when using the fs APIs.

The pattern can start with a variable that resolves to a system base directory. The variables are: `$AUDIO`, `$CACHE`, `$CONFIG`, `$DATA`, `$LOCALDATA`, `$DESKTOP`, `$DOCUMENT`, `$DOWNLOAD`, `$EXE`, `$FONT`, `$HOME`, `$PICTURE`, `$PUBLIC`, `$RUNTIME`, `$TEMPLATE`, `$VIDEO`, `$RESOURCE`, `$APP`, `$LOG`, `$TEMP`, `$APPCONFIG`, `$APPDATA`, `$APPLOCALDATA`, `$APPCACHE`, `$APPLOG`.

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures what kind of
fetch operations are available from the http plugin.

This enables all fetch operations but does not
allow explicitly any origins to be fetched. This needs to
be manually configured before usage.

#### Granted Permissions

All fetch operations are enabled.

allow-fetch.description: Enables the fetch command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-fetch-cancel.description: Enables the fetch_cancel command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-fetch-read-body.description: Enables the fetch_read_body command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-fetch-send.description: Enables the fetch_send command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-fetch.description: Denies the fetch command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-fetch-cancel.description: Denies the fetch_cancel command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-fetch-read-body.description: Denies the fetch_read_body command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-fetch-send.description: Denies the fetch_send command without any pre-configured scope.

anyOf.description:
A URL that can be accessed by the webview when using the HTTP APIs. Wildcards can be used following the URL pattern standard.

See [the URL Pattern spec](https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/) for more information.

Examples:

- "https://*" : allows all HTTPS origin on port 443

- "https://*:*" : allows all HTTPS origin on any port

- "https://*.github.com/tauri-apps/tauri": allows any subdomain of "github.com" with the "tauri-apps/api" path

- "https://myapi.service.com/users/*": allows access to any URLs that begins with "https://myapi.service.com/users/"

url.description:
A URL that can be accessed by the webview when using the HTTP APIs. Wildcards can be used following the URL pattern standard.

See [the URL Pattern spec](https://urlpattern.spec.whatwg.org/) for more information.

Examples:

- "https://*" : allows all HTTPS origin on port 443

- "https://*:*" : allows all HTTPS origin on any port

- "https://*.github.com/tauri-apps/tauri": allows any subdomain of "github.com" with the "tauri-apps/api" path

- "https://myapi.service.com/users/*": allows access to any URLs that begins with "https://myapi.service.com/users/"

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures which
notification features are by default exposed.

#### Granted Permissions

It allows all notification related features.

allow-register-action-types.description: Enables the register_action_types command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-remove-active.description: Enables the remove_active command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-cancel.description: Denies the cancel command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-check-permissions.description: Denies the check_permissions command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-create-channel.description: Denies the create_channel command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-delete-channel.description: Denies the delete_channel command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-get-active.description: Denies the get_active command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-get-pending.description: Denies the get_pending command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-is-permission-granted.description: Denies the is_permission_granted command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-list-channels.description: Denies the list_channels command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-notify.description: Denies the notify command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-permission-state.description: Denies the permission_state command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-register-action-types.description: Denies the register_action_types command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-register-listener.description: Denies the register_listener command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures which
shell functionality is exposed by default.

#### Granted Permissions

It allows to use the `open` functionality without any specific
scope pre-configured. It will allow opening `http(s)://`,
`tel:` and `mailto:` links.

allow-execute.description: Enables the execute command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-kill.description: Enables the kill command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-open.description: Enables the open command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-spawn.description: Enables the spawn command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-stdin-write.description: Enables the stdin_write command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-execute.description: Denies the execute command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-kill.description: Denies the kill command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-open.description: Denies the open command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-spawn.description: Denies the spawn command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-stdin-write.description: Denies the stdin_write command without any pre-configured scope.

args.description: The allowed arguments for the command execution.

cmd.description: The command name. It can start with a variable that resolves to a system base directory. The variables are: `$AUDIO`, `$CACHE`, `$CONFIG`, `$DATA`, `$LOCALDATA`, `$DESKTOP`, `$DOCUMENT`, `$DOWNLOAD`, `$EXE`, `$FONT`, `$HOME`, `$PICTURE`, `$PUBLIC`, `$RUNTIME`, `$TEMPLATE`, `$VIDEO`, `$RESOURCE`, `$LOG`, `$TEMP`, `$APPCONFIG`, `$APPDATA`, `$APPLOCALDATA`, `$APPCACHE`, `$APPLOG`.

name.description:
The name for this allowed shell command configuration.

This name will be used inside of the webview API to call this command along with any specified arguments.

args.description: The allowed arguments for the command execution.

name.description:
The name for this allowed shell command configuration.

This name will be used inside of the webview API to call this command along with any specified arguments.

sidecar.description: If this command is a sidecar command.

anyOf.description: A non-configurable argument that is passed to the command in the order it was specified.
A variable that is set while calling the command from the webview API.

raw.description:
Marks the validator as a raw regex, meaning the plugin should not make any modification at runtime.

This means the regex will not match on the entire string by default, which might be exploited if your regex allow unexpected input to be considered valid. When using this option, make sure your regex is correct.

validator.description:
[regex] validator to require passed values to conform to an expected input.

This will require the argument value passed to this variable to match the `validator` regex before it will be executed.

The regex string is by default surrounded by `^...$` to match the full string. For example the `https?://\w+` regex would be registered as `^https?://\w+$`.

[regex]: <https://docs.rs/regex/latest/regex/#syntax>

ShellScopeEntryAllowedArg.description: A command argument allowed to be executed by the webview API.

anyOf.description: Use a simple boolean to allow all or disable all arguments to this command configuration.
A specific set of [`ShellScopeEntryAllowedArg`] that are valid to call for the command configuration.

ShellScopeEntryAllowedArgs.description:
A set of command arguments allowed to be executed by the webview API.

A value of `true` will allow any arguments to be passed to the command. `false` will disable all arguments. A list of [`ShellScopeEntryAllowedArg`] will set those arguments as the only valid arguments to be passed to the attached command configuration.

default_permission.description:
This permission set configures which kind of
updater functions are exposed to the frontend.

#### Granted Permissions

The full workflow from checking for updates to installing them
is enabled.

allow-check.description: Enables the check command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-download.description: Enables the download command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-download-and-install.description: Enables the download_and_install command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-install.description: Enables the install command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-check.description: Denies the check command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-download.description: Denies the download command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-download-and-install.description: Denies the download_and_install command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-install.description: Denies the install command without any pre-configured scope.

default_permission.description:

operations are available from the window state plugin.

#### Granted Permissions

All operations are enabled by default.

allow-filename.description: Enables the filename command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-restore-state.description: Enables the restore_state command without any pre-configured scope.

allow-save-window-state.description: Enables the save_window_state command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-filename.description: Denies the filename command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-restore-state.description: Denies the restore_state command without any pre-configured scope.

deny-save-window-state.description: Denies the save_window_state command without any pre-configured scope.
